Hovey — 7
It does little g&od to argue that we really had only the alternative
of another Moscow-style dictatorship in Jugoslavia or that the air and
naval bases in Spain would be used to defend Italy* too. In the event of
war. The Italian democrat is apt to look only at the fact that our
economic and military assistance is helping to bolster two dictatorships
in his part of the world*
In fact* I find that military bases question #ne of the hardest
things about American polioy to explain convincingly. I*ve had Italian
friends of series a tell ate seriously that* after all* it isn’t the Soviet
Union but the United States that Is building air bases all over the
landscape*
They argue that military Installations Invariably mean some measure
of control over the people of the countries involved; and they say our
policy of getting bases wherever we can diminishes or destroys the moral
advantage we otherwise would enjoy over the Soviet Union in this struggle
we call the Cold War#
In this connection* these Italians cite American opposition to the
case brought by the Arab and Asian countries in the United Nations against
continued French control of Morocco and Tunisia. And they say — these
Italians — that the American position is dictated not by concern for
freedom and justice but simply by expediency* We need the bases* so we
support French colonialism, which can provide us with the bases. Or* we
support French colonialism because we fear that otherwise we would lose
France as a partner in western defense*
Incidentally* many Italians are convinced that the French would
